alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 2:31PM CDT until May 18 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... West Fork San Jacinto near Humble affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. Cypress Creek at Katy-Hockley Road affecting Waller and Harris Counties. San Bernard River near Boling affecting Fort Bend, Wharton and Brazoria Counties. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas... Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road affecting Montgomery County. .Additional rainfall is possible which could lead to increases in stage levels. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Sendera Ranch Road, Humble...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Cypress Creek...including Katy-Hockley Road...Minor flooding is forecast. For the San Bernard River...including Boling...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Thursday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 133.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 144.3 feet tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 138.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Lake Creek Sendera Ranch Roa 138.0 133.0 Sun 1 pm CDT 143.8 141.3 137.9 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 230 AM CDT.
